[LEXICON]: Awkward phrasing ("Judaism by timbrel on the even of...").
[GRAMMAR]: Minor punctuation errors (e.g., inconsistent comma usage).

[LOGIC]: Loose connection between biblical violence examples and "Chosen People" critique (Chapter I).
[STRUCTURE]: Overly dense paragraphs with layered historical/mathematical references.

[TRANSITION]: Minor disjointedness between biblical examples and broader historical/philosophical discussions

[SYNTAX]: Complex, lengthy sentences may impede smooth readability.
[LEXICON]: Occasionally dense, formal vocabulary (e.g., "veritable museum of relics," "sociological superiorities").

[STRUCTURE]: Multiple layered ideas (universalism, Jewish identity, literary critiques) risk slight disjointedness.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures (e.g., "No universalism away mission...") and potential formatting errors disrupting readability.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures (e.g., multiple nested clauses).

[STRUCTURE]: Repetitive thematic echoes (e.g., "Chosen People" motif) without explicit thematic progression.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between historical/cultural references (e.g., Japan/Prussia to Nietzsche/Fichte).
[CLARITY]: Overly dense paragraphs with disconnected ideas (e.g., shifts between militarism critiques and literary examples).

[SYNTAX]: Extremely convoluted sentence structure (e.g., "Such Huns invaded discarded the perchance Rome...") with illogical word order.
[LEXICON]: Overuse of archaic vocabulary ("thou," "thee") and untranslated Latin quotes disrupting modern readability.
[GRAMMAR]: Missing articles, incorrect prepositions (e.g., "the world gods"), and inconsistent verb tense shifts.

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between biblical critique, national comparisons, and philosophical debates (e.g., Roman Empire to Judaism’s future).
[LOGIC]: Unresolved contradictions (e.g., praising Judaism’s "unique denigration" while criticizing Christian self-adoration).
[CLARITY]: Assumes specialized knowledge (e.g., Kuenen, Eucken, Talmudic references) without contextualization.
